publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2376 Bashir Ahmad: Additional Investment in Scotland’s Dental Services—That the Parliament welcomes the announcement by the Cabinet Secretary for Health and Wellbeing of an additional £75 million in funding for dental services across Scotland; further welcomes the £21.5 million that will be invested in Glasgow over the next two years; notes that many Scots, particularly those in rural areas, struggle to find a place on an NHS dental surgery list, and congratulates the Scottish Government on its effective and thorough response to rising concerns over the lack of NHS dentists in Scotland and its drive to improve standards across Scotland’s dental surgeries. Supported by: Sandra White*, Alasdair Allan*, Bob Doris*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Bill Kidd*, Rob Gibson*, Alex Neil*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-2376 Additional Investment in Scotland’s Dental Services (lodged on 6 August 2008) Aileen Campbell*
S3M-2376Additional Investment in Scotland’s Dental Services (lodged on 6 August 2008) Michael Matheson*
S3M-2376 Additional Investment in Scotland’s Dental Services (lodged on 6 August 2008) Roseanna Cunningham*
S3M-2376 Additional Investment in Scotland’s Dental Services (lodged on 6 August 2008) Keith Brown*
S3M-2376 Additional Investment in Scotland’s Dental Services (lodged on 6 August 2008) Angela Constance*
